# Curve { #ccp.Curve }

```python
Curve(points, extrapolated=False)
```

Curve.

A curve is a collection of points that share the same suction
state and the same speed.

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name   | Type   | Description          | Default    |
|--------|--------|----------------------|------------|
| points | list   | List with the points | _required_ |

## Methods

| Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| [save](#ccp.Curve.save) | Save curve to a file. |
| [save_hysys_csv](#ccp.Curve.save_hysys_csv) | Save curve to a csv with hysys format. |

### save { #ccp.Curve.save }

```python
Curve.save(file_name, file_type='toml')
```

Save curve to a file.

#### Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name      | Type   | Description             | Default    |
|-----------|--------|-------------------------|------------|
| file_name |        | Name of the file.       | _required_ |
| file_type |        | File type can be: toml. | `'toml'`   |

### save_hysys_csv { #ccp.Curve.save_hysys_csv }

```python
Curve.save_hysys_csv(curve_path)
```

Save curve to a csv with hysys format.

curve_path: pathlib.Path
    Path where the curve file will be saved.
